## single image analysis with ImageJ
```{r}
# open image file in imagej
  # file --> open...
# crop image if it includes shadows, edges, background material etc.
  #  drag to desired shape & image --> crop
# make image grayscale
  # image --> type --> 8 bit
# get red leaf images
  # image --> adjust --> threshold
  # uncheck "dark background"
  # click apply = black and white image
# (optional) process --> noise --> despeckle
# analyze --> set measurements
  # check area, std. deviation, display label
  # change decimal to 1
  # redirect to chosen file (optional)
# analyze --> analyze particles
  # set size to 10000-infinity
  # check display results & include holes
# save results spreadsheet

# subsequent files
# file --> open next (only works if your scans are already ordered in a folder)
```
